project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: The ideal would be to use a similar strategy as in the version boards (dots). May be there is a character code for the dot that we can use when filling the options? If not, may be spaces.
fields.summary: Visual feedback of hierarchy in Version Select ComboBox (see details)

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Package, Tag and upload GreenHopper 1.7

fields.summary: Write the release notes and update the documentation

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Add start and end date of the chart in the portlet

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Add a onclick on chart image in the portlet to redirect to the chart board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When dragging a single card in the planning board you are given the option to also move its sub-tasks.  However if you select more than one card, you are not given the option and no subtasks are moved.

Expected: you get the same dialog with a union of all associated sub-tasks.
fields.summary: Sub-tasks are not moved when multiple cards are move during planning

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
In the interest of reducing clicks when planning, adding the Edit button (pencil icon) up next to the issue name in the upper left corner of the card, to jump straight to the Edit screen would be excellent.  

Today you click the title link to get to the View screen, then click the Edit link.  Going straight to the Edit screen would save a good amount of time in a planning session, and you already have the edit icon button concept.  It would fit nicely in the cards.
fields.summary: Add Edit icon button to cards

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When dragging an issue that contains sub-tasks from one version to another, a dialog is displayed asking which sub-tasks should be included.  Almost always you want those sub-tasks to be moved as well, but:
a) They are unchecked by default, and
b) There is no Select All link to check them all at once.  If you are doing sprint planning and you have to click say 8 check boxes you start to feel pretty inefficient.

Expected: would be better if all boxes were checked by default, but either way a Select All button would be the best.
fields.summary: Add Select and Unselect All action when moving issues with sub-tasks between versions

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
1. Go to Chart Board
2. Click calendar icon to set start date or finish date explicitly.  Calendar popup opens.
3. Click a specific date other than the one currently set.
Result:
- Text field shows select date immediately, but reverts to original date after page refreshes.
fields.summary: Cannot set chart start and end dates after upgrading to 1.6

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Allow to edit version name directly in planning board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Exactly like the custom field at creation time, we should be able to select:
- Global context (default)
- List of projects
fields.summary: As a JIRA Admin I would like to restrcit GreenHopper to specific Projects

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
From the Admin section of JIRA add a GreenHopper configuration.
From this section we want to be able to set default values that will be applicable to all projects.
Of course these values can be overwritten by the project configuration.

The values that can be settable from this section are:
- Need Scheduling Permission  	
- Use JIRA look and feel
- Use JIRA IFrame
- Issue Link type
- Card colours
- Task board columns and JIRA workflow statuses.

The other values are Project - Issue Type specific so can't be generalized.
fields.summary: As a JIRA admin I would like to be able to create a default configuration applicable to all projects

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
This graph should present the history of a version based on the issues statues (OPEN vs RESOLVED).
We should also be able to track the issues added or removed from the version.
fields.summary: Burndown, Burnup and value chart : For Number of issues

fields.description: Ensure that greenhopper follows the restriction imposed in permission schemes and global permissions.
fields.summary: Permission Selenium Tests

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: A Warning should popup if this budget is violated. Have a default per project and ability to override.
fields.summary: As a manager I want to be able to set a capacity for my Versions based on a statistic.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Add a screen in a transition to support Mandatory fields

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When I'm logged in to JIRA I see the following links:
HOME, BROWSE PROJECT, FIND ISSUES, CREATE ISSUE, ADMINISTRATION, PLANNING BOARD

Once I click on Planning Board, I get the following links:
HOME, BROWSE PROJECT, FIND ISSUE | PLANNING BOARD, TASK BOARD

I think it would be better to still display create issue and administration in the usual place (if the user has the appropriate permissions of course).  I find it quite annoying that if I want to go to the admin section I have to leave greenhopper first.  Also, the 'New Issue' link in the top right isn't all that obvious.
fields.summary: GreenHopper should show the same links in the main menu bar as when browsing any other page in JIRA

fields.description:
An issue's FIx versions contains only the child version and not the parent (master). This has to be the result of an action made outside of the planning board.

How do we give the visual feedback (like eclipse?)?
Do we provide a way to fix the inconsistency?
fields.summary: Detect inconsistencies for orphan issues in the case of parent-child versions (see details)

fields.description:
When showing a burn down chart and the Assign to Me checkbox is selected, the Greenhopper plugin crashes with the following error. This happens both on our production system and the test system both running the latest 1.5 release. project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We have a multi-site project with subteams across geographically dispersed sites.
We would like to be able to view the entire team burndown with overlay of subteam burndown charts.
For example we would like to view burndown for iteration X and see burndown line based on filter A and another based on filter B.

We have an ecosystem/portfolio of projects that the senior management team would like to track.
They want to be able to create a JIRA dashboard that shows burndown charts for all projects on one page.

It would be nice to see our velocity in planning and chart boards.

The release date registered in JIRA and the one you override in the charts is the begin of the day.
i.e. 31/11/2007 00:00:00

We have changed it to be the end of the day
i.e. 31/11/2007 23:59:59

iteration. We would like to be able to replace status field with assignee field in summary view of cards.

A print button with in banner like other JIRA reports and issue navigator.
This would create page without banner and menu for printing.

project.name: Jira Software Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a sprint has multiple spaces in its name, they are trimmed in the UI (backlog/sprint field) but not in the actual sprint name, making it harder to identify typos and locate your sprint.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a sprint with multiple spaces in its name

!sprint-name-space-trim.gif|width=871,height=548!
h3. Expected Results

The sprint's name should be displayed precisely as-is in both UI and actual sprint name.
h3. Actual Results

Exceeding spaces are trimmed when displayed, causing inconsistency as searching for the same name you see in the UI will have no search results.
This behaviour makes typos harder to spot while preventing you from finding a sprint.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there's no workaround.
fields.summary: Multiple spaces in a sprint's name are trimmed in the UI but not in the sprint's actual name

project.name: Jira Software Cloud

fields.description: We used to be able to add the link of an attachment in previous versions of Jira, can you add that feature back as it provides context, not sure why do you remove a feature which is so useful and saves ton of time
fields.summary: Ability to add link to attachments as inline text as we used to do in On Prem Jira or previous cloud versions

project.name: Jira Software Cloud

fields.description:
When working with Regulatory, they need to see the Epic and User Story summary field (e.g., [BDRC-4503: DID 5.1.1: Software Design - ApplicationTO DO|https://eyecuelab.atlassian.net/browse/BDRC-4503] ), not a URL link to the ticket , (e.g, [https://eyecuelab.atlassian.net/browse/BDRC-4503] ).

When exporting from Confluence, I can only export as the URL and this export is useless to them. Right now, I need to go back and update the text for hundreds of links as a result.
fields.summary: As a Product Owner, I would like the Ticket Summery in the Confluence Export

project.name: Jira Software Cloud

fields.description:
As a user, I would like to have an option to view the "Done" Epics on the Roadmap page. This would allow the user to have both the planning and retrospective view of Done Epics, like the advanced roadmaps allows currently.

i.e. filter/option should show the Epics with the "Epic Status" set to "Done".
fields.summary: Ability to view Done Epic in the basic Roadmap

project.name: Jira Software Cloud

fields.description:
As of now, the linked issue can't be viewed on the same pop-up screen on the Kanban board. The linked issue will open on the new screen.

 !Screen Shot for no pop up.png|thumbnail! 

Implement the ability to open and issues in the pop-up itself instead of opening it in a new tab.

The implementation could be similar to opening an issue in the board as a pop-up or like a sidebar view in the backlog.
fields.summary: Ability to open the linked issue in the Kanban pop up screen instead of a new tab

project.name: Jira Software Cloud

fields.description:
I am VP of Operations and follow many different tickets across many different projects/boards and even in Service Desk.

It would be extremely useful if I could filter all the tickets I am watching to make follow up more productive.
fields.summary: Allow filtering on "Watchers" - "Tickets I am Watching"

project.name: Jira Software Cloud

fields.description: Please add the ability to automate the export of advanced roadmaps as CSV files so it can be scheduled to execute periodically.
fields.summary: Allow scheduled exports for Advanced Roadmaps

project.name: Jira Software Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When accessing a board on Team-managed project with two active sprints generates an error

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install the app Sprint automation for Jira on your Jira instance
 # Have an active sprint and add dates to the next sprint overlapping the end of the current sprint
 # When I added the board in the add-on, I got an error in my board, in the inspect: Multiple active sprints found for agility board [rapidViewId=4].
 # Issue was only solved after the add-on was disabled, and after I cleared cookies and cache and attempted to hard refresh the page several times.

h3. Expected Results
We expect team-managed projects to allow parallel sprints like team-managed projects, or to prevent third-party addons to create parallel sprints in team-managed projects.

h3. Actual Results
Having this scenario throws the following error:
 !image-2021-12-29-13-56-34-183.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
The workaround is to disable the app and clear browser cache and cookies
fields.summary: Accessing a board on Team-managed project with two active sprints generates an error

project.name: Jira Software Cloud

fields.description:
In company-managed simple roadmaps, child issues from Epics can have a schedule bar in the timeline but it is only based on the Sprint dates not in the start and end/due date fields.

It would be helpful if the schedule bar is based on the start and end/due date fields just like Epics.
fields.summary: Make the schedule bar based on the start and end/due date fields just like epics in simple roadmaps

project.name: Jira Software Cloud

fields.description:
*Issue Summary:*
Provide ability to hide custom fields in Issue detail view from board/backlogs when using multiple boards in a single project

*Steps to Reproduce:*
 * Create two boards.
 * Associate custom fields with the project for eg. “Test plan”
 * Configure Test Plan field via “Issue detail view” from Board settings on board A and this field is visible on the detail view.
!fr_boardA_config.png|thumbnail! 
!fr_boardA_detailview.png|thumbnail!

 * Do not configure the test plan field on board B, but it is visible on board B detail view.
!fr_boardB_config.png|thumbnail! 
!fr_boardB_detailview.png|thumbnail! 
*Expected Results:*
 * Expecting that the view should be limited to configured board A and should not show the custom fields for other board B.

*Actual Results:*
The field is visible on detail view of both the boards.

*Workaround:*
Not sure of any workaround.
fields.summary: Provide ability to hide custom fields in Issue detail view on boards and backlog

project.name: Jira Software Cloud

fields.description:
Hi

I feel it would be a great feature to expand or contract all Statuses and/or Sprints in both the Active Sprints and Backlog views

I am not sure if there is a work around or existing way to do this.

Please advise?

Thank you
Yatish
fields.summary: Allow expand/contract all in Active sprint/Backlog view

project.name: Jira Software Cloud

fields.description:
As a user, I would like to have an option to add Done Epics to the Roadmap so we can have a unified view on the Roadmap of all the done epics for the year.

 Epics with Epic Status done are not displayed in the default Roadmap, we would like an option to display these epics as well.
fields.summary: As a user I would like to have an option to add Done Epics to the Roadmap

project.name: Jira Software Cloud

fields.description:
The current API to rank things is kind of a pain to use because you have to know where something else currently is in the backlog before re-ranking an item relative to it. 

I just want to be able to push items to the top or bottom of the backlog in a way that doesn't require retrieving lists of issues and inspecting ranks, etc. just to rank an item at the top or the bottom of the list.

 

This is available in the Backlog view by right clicking an issue
fields.summary: Add "Top/Bottom of the Backlog" function to the API so its like the UI

project.name: Jira Software Cloud

fields.description:
Introduce a warning option for issues with start or end dates outside of the assigned sprint.

Currently, a warning will only be triggered if the issues' start and end dates are both out of assigned sprint dates.
fields.summary: Warning option for issues with start and end dates outside of assigned sprint

project.name: Jira Software Cloud

fields.description: Need to sort Type (Bug, Story and Task) further by Status (To Do, Done, Dev In Progress etc.)
fields.summary: Feature Request

project.name: Jira Software Cloud

fields.description: As a user, once submitted a form from a Jira Work Management project, it would be nice to be redirected to the project's issues in which you just submitted another issue form. Or also, to have a button to be redirected back to the project's issues instead of the My Work page.
fields.summary: After creating a form in JWM, redirect the user to the project's issue list

project.name: Jira Software Cloud

fields.summary: Automation documentation should have information about project properties smart value

project.name: Jira Software Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Problem summary

There are a limited amount of fields that can be used in the filtering options for the *Scope* view and there are no options to include custom fields.

 !TST7_SCRUM_-_Advanced_Roadmaps_-_Jira.png|thumbnail! 

This blocks users from doing things like filtering out issues based on their *Due date* or *Start date*.

h3. Proposed solution

The *Filters* should include more commonly used fields from Plans as well as provide the option to add custom fields to the filtering.

h3. Workaround

Users would have to rely on their *Issue sources* to filter issues based on custom fields using JQL (filter or board).
fields.summary: More filtering options for the scope view

project.name: Jira Software Cloud

fields.description: Introduce the ability to display a custom field value in the time of Advanced Roadmaps.
fields.summary: Ability to display a custom field on the timeline

project.name: Jira Software Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Reordering the issues in backlog and going back to Active Sprints causes *Something's gone wrong* error.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Active sprints
 # Go to the backlog
 # Make sure one of the issues is open in detailed view, if it is not click on one to be opened 
 # Change the order of issues (Drag & Drop)
 # Go back to the Active sprints board 

h3. Expected Results
Not to receive an error

h3. Actual Results
Causes the following error:
Something's gone wrong. Our team has been notified. If the problem persists, please contact Atlassian Support.
ERROR: 11QJA46
Reload page

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Reordering the issues in backlog and going back to Active Sprints causes Something's gone wrong

project.name: Jira Software Cloud

fields.description:
# Capitalization of the word "status", in "Sortieren nach status" under the sorting criterion of issue listing in epics.
!image-2021-12-20-19-49-40-693.png|width=187,height=372!
 # "Sortieren" should be "sortiert" (a participle), because it means no action to be performed but should inform that the sorting action has been performed and you now see the result.
 # when sorting by assigned person, it should be either "Sortiert nach zugewiesener Person" or "Sortiert nach 'zugewiesene Person'".
fields.summary: German localization of Jira needs a few change

project.name: Jira Software Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you have more than one Sprint on a board and you select one, this selection is not respected the next time you open the board despite the filter says Jira does. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Activate Parallel Sprints feature and have at least two active sprints on the same board
 # Access to a Sprint board and filter one Sprint.
 # Close the web browser tab
 # open jira site-url.atlassian.net/jira/your-work
 # use the quick access to the board in the recent items dashboard:  !image-2020-11-02-11-30-57-590.png|width=600,height=200!
 # Jira won't filter the selected/last selected filter.

h3. Expected Results

The board should filter the issues of the last selected Sprint.
h3. Actual Results

Jira is displaying all issues despite the board indicates one Sprint is selected.
h3. Workaround

Refresh the page or change Sprint from the filter.
fields.summary: Using the quick access to a board doesn't respect the last selected Sprint

project.name: Jira Software Cloud

fields.description:
Hey, I'm looking for a file for the ability to create dependencies between custom fields.
I found only the Proforma add-on option but it's not available for cloud users.

will it be available in the coming future? can you suggest other solutions?

the use case I want to create is to have a dropdown single selection field with some options  (e.g option 1, option 2) and another custom single field selection with other options (e.g option 1.1 option 2.1), and when I am changing my selection in the first field it will change the options in the second field relatively. 

I saw that Proforma provide this option, but not for cloud :(

I would love to hear your suggestions.

Thansk
fields.summary: Proforma fro cloud users

project.name: Jira Software Cloud

fields.description: Changing issue types with the "Move" functionality is tedious and takes too many clicks. If the icon for issue type were a pull-down menu that a user could select to change the issue type, this would greatly help my team better track the nature of our work
fields.summary: There should be a pull-down that allows users to change issue types with a single click

project.name: Jira Software Cloud

fields.description:
As a project manager in the advanced roadmap plans, I want to be able to move epics between initiatives in a plan so that I can 'stage' the suggested hierarchy moves and then review/execute the moves all at once. 

 

It is odd to me that you can click and drag an epic in the interface for plans, but doesn't actually do anything besides change the order or the epics or initiatives in the plan. Either implement a different UI paradigm so that users do not think they have the ability to move cards around in the hierarchy freely, or institute a way to change parent and epic links from the plan screen.
fields.summary: Add Parent Link and Epic Link to Fields in Advanced Roadmap Plans

project.name: Jira Software Cloud

fields.description:
Currently, the default sort option in the Issues Type view is set to Order by alphabetical. This default cannot be changed.
Example:
In the Project menu, sometimes the first type of problem is epic, and in other projects the first type of problem might be bugs or another type.
I would like to change this order, not just alphabetical order.
fields.summary: Ability to change default sort option on the Issues page
